original: khro ba yod pa ma yin pa ni khro ba med cing khro ba spangs pa ste /
analyzed: khro ba yod pa ma yin pa ni khro ba med cing khro ba spangs pa ste /

original: khro ba la sogs pa so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir ro //

original: sbrul nag po yod pa'am 'ang ba med na /
analyzed: sbrul nag po yod pa'am 'ang ba med na /

original: des zin pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: des zin pa lta ga la yod /

original: de ltar khro ba med na ji ltar de mngon sum du 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar khro ba med na ji ltar de mngon sum du 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: In the same way, if there is no anger, how can it arise in actuality?

original: rim pa gang gis khro ba spangs par bshad pa rig par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rim pa gang gis khro ba spangs par bshad pa rig par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the stages by which anger is abandoned,

original: dul zhing zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dul zhing zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äútamed,‚Äù

original: dbang po drug dul ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po drug dul ba ste /
translated: and ‚Äúthe six senses are tamed.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir dbang po dul na ni bzod pa sten pa'i phyir khro ba 'gag pa @38b yin te ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po dul na ni bzod pa sten pa'i phyir khro ba 'gag pa @38b yin te ;
translated: Because when the six senses are tamed, anger is stopped because one cultivates patience.

original: 'dis ni dbang po sdom pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dbang po sdom pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the restraint of the faculties.

original: de ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa bstan pa'i phyir rigs pas 'tsho ba dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa bstan pa'i phyir rigs pas 'tsho ba dang zhes bya ba smos te /

original: snyoms pas 'tsho ba ni rigs pas 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: snyoms pas 'tsho ba ni rigs pas 'tsho ba ste /
translated: He lives righteously because he lives with equanimity.

original: de ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang ldan ba yin pas 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dag par ston par byed de /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang ldan ba yin pas 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dag par ston par byed de /
translated: This shows the purity of the restraint of morality,

original: log pa'i 'tsho bas ni de yongs su dag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i 'tsho bas ni de yongs su dag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not pure for one who has wrong livelihood.

original: de gnyi ga'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩyang dag shes bas rnam grol ba //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir / yang dag shes bas rnam grol ba //
translated: In order to show the result of both, he says,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHe is liberated by right knowledge.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni khro ba gtan du spangs par ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni khro ba gtan du spangs par ston te /
translated: This shows the complete abandonment of anger.

original: shin tu mthar thug par 'jug pa zag pa med pa'i shes pas nyon mongs ba thob pa dang ; shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i de bzhin gshegs pas ni yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po la gnas bar mdzad pas yang dag pa'i shes bas ni kun du shes shing 'phags pa'i lam gyis spangs pa'i phyir khro ba med de /
analyzed: shin tu mthar thug par 'jug pa zag pa med pa'i shes pas nyon mongs ba thob pa dang ; shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i de bzhin gshegs pas ni yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po la gnas bar mdzad pas yang dag pa'i shes bas ni kun du shes shing 'phags pa'i lam gyis spangs pa'i phyir khro ba med de /
translated: Since he has completely understood through correct knowledge and abandoned through the noble path, he is without anger.

original: des na de nyid kyis na zhe sdang kun du 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: des na de nyid kyis na zhe sdang kun du 'byung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, he is without the occurrence of hatred.

original: 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the perfection of abandonment, to teach the perfection of knowledge, he said:

original: mkhas pa rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The wise,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi don mtha' dag shes pa'i phyir mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi don mtha' dag shes pa'i phyir mkhas pa ste /
translated: because they know the meaning of reality in its entirety, are wise.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyud la gnas pa la ni khro ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi go skabs bdag nyid kyis sel ba yin pa'i phyir 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyud la gnas pa la ni khro ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi go skabs bdag nyid kyis sel ba yin pa'i phyir 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught because the wise who abide in the continuum of omniscience themselves eliminate the opportunity for the latent tendencies of affliction such as anger.

original: yang na mkhas pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la ste mthong ba dang bsgom pas slob pa'i lam la ni 'di lta bur mkhas pa yin pa'i phyir phra rgyas 'byung ba mi srid do //
analyzed: yang na mkhas pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la ste mthong ba dang bsgom pas slob pa'i lam la ni 'di lta bur mkhas pa yin pa'i phyir phra rgyas 'byung ba mi srid do //
translated: Or else, the wise who are on the path of learning, who see and meditate on the four noble truths, are skilled in this way, so it is impossible for them to generate negative tendencies.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar sma ba la sogs pa'i khyad bar dang ldan pa la khro ba 'di lta bu med ce na bshad pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar sma ba la sogs pa'i khyad bar dang ldan pa la khro ba 'di lta bu med ce na bshad pa /
translated: Why is it that anger does not exist in those who possess such special qualities of speech and so on?

original: dge ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are virtuous.

original: skye bo dge ba la ni khro ba gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye bo dge ba la ni khro ba gnas pa ma yin no //

original: dper na dpag bsam gyi shing la ni bya rgod la sogs ba dur khrod kyi bya rnams brten pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na dpag bsam gyi shing la ni bya rgod la sogs ba dur khrod kyi bya rnams brten pa ma yin gyi /

original: shang shang de'u la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i bya rnams ni yang dag par brten pa yin te /
analyzed: shang shang de'u la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i bya rnams ni yang dag par brten pa yin te /
translated: The birds that are desired, such as the shang shang deer, are well supported.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate just this, he says:

original: khro ba med dang 'tshe med la //
analyzed: khro ba med dang 'tshe med la //
translated: Without anger, without violence,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: khro ba med dang 'tshe med ces bya ba las /
analyzed: khro ba med dang 'tshe med ces bya ba las /
translated: Without anger, without violence.

original: zhe sdang med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / snying rje ste 'di gnyis la'o //üîΩ'phags @39a * //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / snying rje ste 'di gnyis la'o // 'phags @39a * //
translated: Of these two, the root of merit of non-hatred and compassion.

original: pa'i skye pos rtag bsten kyang //
analyzed: pa'i skye pos rtag bsten kyang //

original: zhes bya ba ni skye bo dam pa rgyun du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye bo dam pa rgyun du gnas pa ste /

original: 'phags pa nyid ni des nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyid ni des nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the noble one is characterized by them.

original: de med na ni dam pa nyid du gsal ba med do //üîΩbdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa ni dam pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: de med na ni dam pa nyid du gsal ba med do // bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa ni dam pa rnams yin la /
translated: If they do not exist, the clarity of the noble one does not exist.üîΩThe accomplishment of one's own and others' goals is the noble one.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i rgyu yang bzod pa dang snying rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i rgyu yang bzod pa dang snying rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: And the cause of accomplishing one's own and others' goals is patience, compassion, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bzod pa ni bdag nyid la gnod par mi byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bzod pa ni bdag nyid la gnod par mi byed pa yin la /
translated: Because patience does not harm oneself.

original: snying rjes ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snying rjes ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Forbearance does not harm oneself, and compassion does not harm others.

original: 'dis ni sgo rnam pa gnyis nas yon tan bstan pa yin te /üîΩbzod pas ni gzhan gyis /
analyzed: 'dis ni sgo rnam pa gnyis nas yon tan bstan pa yin te / bzod pas ni gzhan gyis /
translated: This shows the virtues in two ways.

original: gnod pa byas pa bzod pa yin la /
analyzed: gnod pa byas pa bzod pa yin la /
translated: By forbearance, one forbears the harm done by others.

original: 'tshe ba med pas ni gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pas ni gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pa'o //

analyzed: khro ba med pa la sogs pa tshig rkang gnyis kyis bstan to zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say that the two lines ‚Äúwithout anger, etc.‚Äù show the virtues of non-anger and non-violence.

original: de lta bas na skye bo sdig pa can ji ltar skur bar byed ce na /
analyzed: de lta bas na skye bo sdig pa can ji ltar skur bar byed ce na /

original: skye bo sdig can khro ba dag / ces smos te /
analyzed: skye bo sdig can khro ba dag / ces smos te /

original: sdig pa byed pa la mkhas pa'i sems can te /
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa la mkhas pa'i sems can te /

original: skye bo ngan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye bo ngan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: khro ba dag ces brjod pas ni rnam par 'tshe ba yang sgrub pa yin te /

original: gang zhig bdag nyid la yang gnod pa byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig bdag nyid la yang gnod pa byed pa yin na /

original: gzhan la lta smos kyang byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la lta smos kyang byed ces bya ba'i don to //

original: rnam par 'tshe ba yang skye bo ngan pa'i rgyud nyid la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba yang skye bo ngan pa'i rgyud nyid la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Malice also occurs in the continuum of an evil person.

original: gang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: ri bo bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ri bo bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /

original: dper na brag chen po 'am ri ni sa la gnas par byed pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na brag chen po 'am ri ni sa la gnas par byed pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as a great rock or mountain remains on the earth, so does malice.

original: gang khro ba spangs pa de las mi skye ba de ni ngo mtshar med kyi /
analyzed: gang khro ba spangs pa de las mi skye ba de ni ngo mtshar med kyi /
translated: It is not surprising that malice does not arise in one who has abandoned anger.

original: khro ba ma spangs pa de la ni rmad du byung ba yin te /
analyzed: khro ba ma spangs pa de la ni rmad du byung ba yin te /

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: aa gra ta ba ka zhes bya ba'i yul na dge slong zhig khro ba byung yang tshig rtsub po mi brjod pa de las brtsams so zhes gzhan dag zer ro //

original: gang zhig 'jig rten 'di na'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten 'di na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this world‚Äù means in this world.

original: byung ba ni skyes pa mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba ni skyes pa mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen‚Äù means arisen, manifested.

original: khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnger‚Äù means hatred.

original: 'dzin par byed pa ni 'byung ba 'gog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa ni 'byung ba 'gog par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSubduing‚Äù means stopping the elements.

analyzed: ma dul ba non pa 'khyams zhes bya ba ni ma dul ba'i rte'u dang rta la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúUntamed‚Äù means like a calf or horse that has not been tamed.

original: dper na aa na pa se ka zhes bya ba'i 'dul sbyong mkhan shin tu mgyogs par rgyug pa dang / ma dul zhing 'gros myur ba'i rta la sogs pa lam ma yin pa las ji @39b ltar 'dod pa gzhan du bzlog pa dang zhon par byed pa ji lta ba de nyid ni 'dul sbyong mkhan gyi mchog yin pa de bzhin du de /üîΩ'dul sbyong mkhan du ngas gsungs kyi //
analyzed: dper na aa na pa se ka zhes bya ba'i 'dul sbyong mkhan shin tu mgyogs par rgyug pa dang / ma dul zhing 'gros myur ba'i rta la sogs pa lam ma yin pa las ji @39b ltar 'dod pa gzhan du bzlog pa dang zhon par byed pa ji lta ba de nyid ni 'dul sbyong mkhan gyi mchog yin pa de bzhin du de / 'dul sbyong mkhan du ngas gsungs kyi //
translated: For example, a trainer named Anupaseka, who was very fast, ran and rode on untamed and fast-running horses and so on, turning them away from the wrong path as he wished and making them rideable. Just as he was the supreme trainer,üîΩI declare him to be the supreme trainer here.

original: zhes pa ni de nyid 'dir 'dul sbyong mkhan gyi mchog yin par rtogs so //üîΩzhags 'debs skye bo phal pa yin //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de nyid 'dir 'dul sbyong mkhan gyi mchog yin par rtogs so // zhags 'debs skye bo phal pa yin //
translated: This shows that he is the supreme trainer here.üîΩOrdinary people are like those who throw lassos.

original: zhes bya bya ni phal pa'i bzhon pa dul ba la zhon par byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bya ni phal pa'i bzhon pa dul ba la zhon par byed pa ste /
translated: Ordinary people ride tamed mounts.

original: gang des ni de ltar nus pa ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gang des ni de ltar nus pa ma yin no zhes so //

original: zhags pa ni 'dir yang dag par 'dul bar byed pa'i thag pa de la bzung ste /
analyzed: zhags pa ni 'dir yang dag par 'dul bar byed pa'i thag pa de la bzung ste /
translated: The rope is the rope that tames the horse properly.

original: gang de ni zhags pa nyi tshes bzung ba ste /
analyzed: gang de ni zhags pa nyi tshes bzung ba ste /
translated: The one who holds the rope is the one who holds the rope of the horse.

original: srab la sogs pa rta la lar khrid cing khyer te mi bzhon pa yang yod pas so //
analyzed: srab la sogs pa rta la lar khrid cing khyer te mi bzhon pa yang yod pas so //
translated: There are some who lead and carry the horse with a bridle, but do not ride it.

original: de ni rab tu grags pa'i phal pa'i 'dul sbyong mkhan yin no //
analyzed: de ni rab tu grags pa'i phal pa'i 'dul sbyong mkhan yin no //
translated: He is the most famous trainer of ordinary horses.

original: gang yang bzhon pa 'khyams par gyur kyang lam las zlog par byed pa de nyid ni kha lo sgyur ba'i mchog ces brjod de /
analyzed: gang yang bzhon pa 'khyams par gyur kyang lam las zlog par byed pa de nyid ni kha lo sgyur ba'i mchog ces brjod de /
translated: The one who, even when the horse wanders off, turns it back from the path, is called the supreme charioteer.

original: de bzhin du gang zhig yul la khro ba 'jug pa de las zlog par byed pa de nyid ni sems 'dul bar byed pa'i 'dul sbyong mkhan mchog yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig yul la khro ba 'jug pa de las zlog par byed pa de nyid ni sems 'dul bar byed pa'i 'dul sbyong mkhan mchog yin no //
translated: In the same way, the one who turns back the mind from engaging in anger towards objects is the supreme trainer who tames the mind.

original: khro ba'i tshoms te nyi shu pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: khro ba'i tshoms te nyi shu pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on anger, the twentieth, is completed.

original: // / bag chags dang bcas pa'i khro ba'i dri ma thams cad spangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni 'dul sbyong mkhan gyi mchog yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshoms bstan to //üîΩyang na khro ba bkag cing pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstsags te snying rje bskyed nas nges de drungs phyung bas /
analyzed: // / bag chags dang bcas pa'i khro ba'i dri ma thams cad spangs pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni 'dul sbyong mkhan gyi mchog yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshoms bstan to // yang na khro ba bkag cing pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstsags te snying rje bskyed nas nges de drungs phyung bas /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is the supreme trainer because he has abandoned all the stains of anger together with their traces.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang 'thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshoms 'di bkod de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang 'thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshoms 'di bkod de /
translated: Or else, this chapter is taught in order to show that one attains the state of a TathƒÅgata by stopping anger, accumulating the six perfections, generating compassion, and then uprooting it.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that very point, he says:

original: 'jig rten 'di na kun rig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na kun rig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i 'og tu mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas chos bstan pa'i phyir gus pa dang bcas pas gsol ba btab po /
translated: After attaining perfect enlightenment, BrahmƒÅ, the lord of the SahƒÅ world, respectfully requested the TathƒÅgata to teach the Dharma.

original: thub pa mchog gis 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: thub pa mchog gis 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: The Supreme Sage thought this:

analyzed: thog mar bdag gis chos 'di su la bstan par bya zhes dgongs pa las /

analyzed: ji tsam na rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod ni zhag bdun gyi sngon du dus las 'das so //
translated: Then he thought, Rangjey Kyibu Lhakshod had died seven days earlier.

original: sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring 'phur yang dus las 'das te /
analyzed: sgyu rtsal shes kyi bu ring 'phur yang dus las 'das te /
translated: Gyutsuy Tsal Shergyibu Ringphur had also died.

original: de bas na @40a * //
analyzed: de bas na @40a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: lnga sde rnams kyi phyir bstan to zhes dgongs nas /
analyzed: lnga sde rnams kyi phyir bstan to zhes dgongs nas /
translated: I will teach it for the sake of the group of five.

original: bcom ldan 'das b'a r'a na s'ir gshegs te bcom ldan 'das mthong ba dang / kun du 'tsho nyer 'gros smras pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das b'a r'a na s'ir gshegs te bcom ldan 'das mthong ba dang / kun du 'tsho nyer 'gros smras pa /
translated: The Bhagavan went to Varanasi and when the group of five saw the Bhagavan, they said to the one who was living the holy life,

original: tshe dang ldan pa goo ta ma dbang po rnams ni rnam par dang / bzhin gyi mdog ni yongs su dag pags pa'i mdog ni dkar na tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyi ston pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa goo ta ma dbang po rnams ni rnam par dang / bzhin gyi mdog ni yongs su dag pags pa'i mdog ni dkar na tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyi ston pa ni gang yin /
translated: Venerable Gautama, your faculties are clear and your complexion is pure and bright. Venerable, who is your teacher?

original: gang gi bstan pa la ni rab tu byung /
analyzed: gang gi bstan pa la ni rab tu byung /
translated: In whose doctrine have you gone forth?üîΩ In whose doctrine do you delight?

original: gang gi chos la ni dga' zhes smras pa dang / ji tsam na 'di dag gsungs te /

original: rna bas zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i dbang po 'am de'i rnam par shes pas te /

analyzed: thos pa ni 'di la rag las pa'i phyir ro // mig gis mang po mthong na yang //

original: zhes pa ni rnam pa mang po mthong ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam pa mang po mthong ba ste /

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi yul gyis byas pa'o ;üîΩ/ brtan pa mthong thos de kun gyis //
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi yul gyis byas pa'o ; / brtan pa mthong thos de kun gyis //

original: yid ches bya ba'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: yid ches bya ba'i mi rigs so //
translated: The wise should not believeüîΩall that is seen or heard.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang cung zad mthong ba dang thos pa de thams cad ni mkhas pas de bzhin du yid ches pas 'jug par mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang cung zad mthong ba dang thos pa de thams cad ni mkhas pas de bzhin du yid ches pas 'jug par mi bya ste /
translated: This means that the wise should not engage in believing everything that is seen or heard to be just so,

original: rmongs pa dang slu ba'i dngos po yin te /
analyzed: rmongs pa dang slu ba'i dngos po yin te /
translated: because it is a deluded and deceptive thing,

analyzed: smig rgyu dang sgra brnyan la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a mirage, an echo, and so on.

original: thos pa'i 'bras bu ni don rtogs pa dang de'i rjes su mthun pa las yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thos pa'i 'bras bu ni don rtogs pa dang de'i rjes su mthun pa las yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that the result of hearing is the realization of the meaning and that which is consistent with it, it says:

original: legs gsungs thos pa snying por shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: legs gsungs thos pa snying por shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The essence is knowing the well-spoken teaching.

original: nye dga' sde snod gsum pa yin yang brkam zhing ser sna che bas khyim bdag gi khyim la sogs pa dag tu bab col du byed de /
analyzed: nye dga' sde snod gsum pa yin yang brkam zhing ser sna che bas khyim bdag gi khyim la sogs pa dag tu bab col du byed de /
translated: Upananda, though a Tripi·π≠aka master, was greedy and stingy, and so he would go to the houses of householders and so on without being invited.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //

original: shes pa ni rtogs pa'i don legs par gsungs pa'i snying po gang yin pa de nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa ni rtogs pa'i don legs par gsungs pa'i snying po gang yin pa de nyid do //
translated: Knowledge is the essence of the well-spoken teaching, which is the meaning of realization.

original: 'dir don gyi sgra ni phyi nas bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir don gyi sgra ni phyi nas bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the word meaning should be understood as explained later.

original: yang na shes pa ni de nyid kyi don de kho na nyid rtogs pa gang yin pa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: yang na shes pa ni de nyid kyi don de kho na nyid rtogs pa gang yin pa'i snying po'o //
translated: Or, knowledge is the essence of that very meaning, the realization of reality, which is the essence.

original: gang dag las de kho na nyid kyi blo ma skyes pa de ni snying po dang ldan zhing legs par gsungs pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang dag las de kho na nyid kyi blo ma skyes pa de ni snying po dang ldan zhing legs par gsungs pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that for those in whom the mind of reality has not arisen, it is not endowed with essence, and the well-spoken teaching is not fruitful.

original: rang nyid legs par gsungs pa'i don ma rtogs shing mi dran pa dang des bstan pa'i thos pa ni dgos pa med de bram ze koo shi ka'i khyim du bram ze bar dva dza mgron du gyur pas 'ongs te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba glegs bam las
analyzed: rang nyid legs par gsungs pa'i don ma rtogs shing mi dran pa dang des bstan pa'i thos pa ni dgos pa med de bram ze koo shi ka'i khyim du bram ze bar dva dza mgron du gyur pas 'ongs te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba glegs bam las
translated: One who does not understand the meaning of the well-spoken teachings, who does not remember them, and who has heard them without purpose, is like the brahmin who came to the house of the brahmin Kausika as a guest.

original: bklags pa tsam gyis khyad par thos par ma gyur pa 'dir dper brjod par bya'o//
analyzed: bklags pa tsam gyis khyad par thos par ma gyur pa 'dir dper brjod par bya'o//
translated: He read the dependent origination from a book, but did not understand it through hearing it. This is an example.

original: @54a * // thos ba dang zhes bya ba la dang gi sgra ni snying po'o //
analyzed: @54a * // thos ba dang zhes bya ba la dang gi sgra ni snying po'o //

original: shes pa dang zhes bya ba 'dren pa'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa dang zhes bya ba 'dren pa'i don to //

original: gzhan las 'ongs pa ni thos pa ste de bas kyang don shes pa snying po nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan las 'ongs pa ni thos pa ste de bas kyang don shes pa snying po nyid do //
translated: What comes from others is hearing, and that is the essence of understanding the meaning.

original: sngar bshad pa nyi tsher ma zad de legs par gsungs pa rang nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba de gal te ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa nyi tsher ma zad de legs par gsungs pa rang nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba de gal te ma rtogs pa'o //

analyzed: yang na gzhan las thos na ni de'i tshe bya'i skad bzhin du don med par blta bar bya'o //

original: ting nge 'dzin dag snying por shes gyur kyang //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dag snying por shes gyur kyang //
translated: Even though one knows the essence of the meditative concentrations,

original: zhes bya ba ni shes pa dben pa'i khyad par can 'jig rten pa'i shes pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi tshogs su gyur pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes pa dben pa'i khyad par can 'jig rten pa'i shes pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi tshogs su gyur pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: ting nge 'dzin dag ces bya ba ni dge ba la sems rtse gcig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dag ces bya ba ni dge ba la sems rtse gcig pa la sogs pa'o //

original: snying po dang 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni de nyid do //
analyzed: snying po dang 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni de nyid do //
translated: The essence and fruit are just that.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /

original: gzhan las mthos pa dang / 'di thos pa dang / ldan pa de gnyis ka yang 'dir sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan las mthos pa dang / 'di thos pa dang / ldan pa de gnyis ka yang 'dir sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: It is superior to others and it is endowed with what is heard. Both of these should be applied here.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: rang nyid kyis legs par bshad pa mthong ba'am gzhan las so //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis legs par bshad pa mthong ba'am gzhan las so //
translated: One sees the good explanation either by oneself or from another.

analyzed: ji ltar rang gis legs par bshad pa'i don rtogs pa'am /

original: gzhan las thos pas don rtogs pa thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes rab khyad par can skyes pa yin pas zhi gnas kyang de'i tshe legs par bshad pa'i don rtogs pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs par 'thob pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin
analyzed: gzhan las thos pas don rtogs pa thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes rab khyad par can skyes pa yin pas zhi gnas kyang de'i tshe legs par bshad pa'i don rtogs pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs par 'thob pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin
translated: Since one generates the special wisdoms of hearing, contemplation, and meditation, one also obtains the perfect result of the meaning of the well-explained Dharma at that time.üîΩIn order to teach just that,

original: no // de nyid 'dir bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: no // de nyid 'dir bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: gang zhig bag med brlang por byed pa de'i //
analyzed: gang zhig bag med brlang por byed pa de'i //
translated: For those who are careless and reckless,

original: thos dang shes pa don chen mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thos dang shes pa don chen mi 'gyur ro //

original: zhes bya ba ste gang zhig brlang por byed pa zhes bya ba ni gti mug gis bab col du byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste gang zhig brlang por byed pa zhes bya ba ni gti mug gis bab col du byed pa ste /

analyzed: nges par brtag pa med cing bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa dag la ma brtags par zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: bag med pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin sgom pa la sbyor ba lhod pa'o /
translated: carelessness is laxity in applying oneself to cultivating samƒÅdhi.

original: de dag ni go rims bzhin du shes pa khyad par can du gyur pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par ma tshang ba ste bdag nyid legs par gsungs pa yongs su ma shes pa'am mi bzod pas phan yon la rab tu mi spyod do //
analyzed: de dag ni go rims bzhin du shes pa khyad par can du gyur pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par ma tshang ba ste bdag nyid legs par gsungs pa yongs su ma shes pa'am mi bzod pas phan yon la rab tu mi spyod do //
translated: These are, respectively, the special transformation of consciousness and the incompleteness of the special meditative concentration.

original: de grub na ni sngar bstan pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'grub po //
analyzed: de grub na ni sngar bstan pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'grub po //
translated: When that is accomplished, the previously mentioned desired result is accomplished.üîΩThe section on the side of virtue is finished.

original: dkar po'i phyogs bsten @54b pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs bsten @54b pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: It was said:

analyzed: gang zhig 'phags pas bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni gsung rab kyi chos te //
translated: The term ‚ÄúDharma‚Äù refers to the Dharma of scripture.

original: legs par gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: legs par gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don to /

original: gang gis bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis bstan pa yin zhe na /

original: gang zhig 'phags pas bstan pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'phags pas bstan pa zhes bya ba yin te /

analyzed: 'phags pa ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skye ba'i gnas spangs shing 'das pa'i phyir te /
translated: The noble ones are those who have abandoned the abode of birth in the three realms and have passed beyond attachment to the three realms.

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis de bstan cing bshad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äútaught and explained by the Buddhas and the disciples of the Buddhas‚Äù is that the Buddhas and their disciples have taught and explained the Dharma.

original: gang zhig la sems can dga' ba zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la mngon par dga' ba tsam gyis legs par spyod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gyi sgra'o //
analyzed: gang zhig la sems can dga' ba zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la mngon par dga' ba tsam gyis legs par spyod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gyi sgra'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe delight of sentient beings‚Äù indicates that the Dharma is not just a mere delight in reality.

original: dga' ba thob pa ni mngon par dga' ba'i mtshan nyid dad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde'i phyir dad pas ni chos la dga' bar 'gyur la /

analyzed: dad pa'i rtags ni dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The sign of faith is delight in listening to the true Dharma. This is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúdelight in listening to the true Dharma.‚Äù

original: de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu /
translated: After that,

analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa bstan to //

original: de dag bzod ldan 'grogs dga' dbang po bsdams //
analyzed: de dag bzod ldan 'grogs dga' dbang po bsdams //

translated: The statement ‚Äúthey are patient‚Äù means that they are patient in the sense of being indifferent to suffering and patient in the sense of certainty that is brought about by the path of seeing.

analyzed: 'grogs dga' zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa chung zhing chog shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthey are agreeable to live with‚Äù means that they are agreeable to live with because they have a mind that is characterized by few desires and contentment.

analyzed: dbang po bsdams pa ni mnyam par gzhag cing mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dul ba gang yin pa'o //

original: de ltar gyur pa la ni thos pa zhes bya ba legs par mnyan pa dang shes pa zhes bya ba'i don rtogs pa'o //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa thob ces bya ba ni shin tu pha mthar gyur cing mya ngan las @55a * //

translated: One who is thus is said to be ‚Äúlearned,‚Äù that is, to have listened well, and is said to ‚Äúknow,‚Äù that is, to have understood the meaning.

original: 'das pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa thob pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving attained the perfections‚Äù means having gone to the very end and attained nirvana.

original: 'di lta ste sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos so //
translated: This is the Buddha and the Buddha‚Äôs disciples.

analyzed: thos pa'i tshoms te nyi shu gnyis pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on learning, the twenty-second, is completed.

original: // / don dam par thos pa'i 'bras bu ni bdag nyid gdul ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu bdag gi tshoms bstan te /üîΩlegs par gsungs la bslab bya zhing //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should train in the well-spoken‚Äù and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis bzang ba'i rang bzhin can gyis rigs kyi bu de ni dge ba'i gshes gnyen nye bar sten par byed cing dge slong mang po sdud par byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /üîΩdes de dag la chos 'di lta ste /üîΩmdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa ji snyed pa de legs par shin tu nyan par byed cing khyim du bdag nyid gcig pus bsams shing bsgoms te de nyid kyi tshul gyis sems dul ba thob par byas nas sems dang mnyam du sems nye

translated: The one who is naturally good, the one who is naturally virtuous, the son of good family, is one who attends on spiritual friends, who is of the nature of one who gathers many monks.üîΩHe listens well and thoroughly to whatever they teach, such as the sutra collection, the melody collection, etc.üîΩHe reflects and meditates on them by himself in his own home.

original: bar zhi bar gyur te /
analyzed: bar zhi bar gyur te /
translated: By that method, he attains a tamed mind, and his mind becomes peaceful, in accord with his mind.

original: des na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: des na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he speaks two verses.üîΩThe one who is naturally good is the one who is naturally virtuous.

original: rang gi don du gsungs pa ni legs par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don du gsungs pa ni legs par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Well-spoken means spoken for one's own benefit.

analyzed: legs par gsungs pa la bslab par bya ba ni mnyan par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: yang na legs par gsungs pa de dang 'brel pa ste /

analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i shes pa chos la chos kyi rjes su 'jug pas de la bslab cing brten pa dang rjes su 'jug par bya'o zhes pa'o //

translated: The well-spoken is mostly heard from the Well-Gone Ones and the Well-Gone Ones' sons. Therefore, in order to teach just that, it is said:üîΩOne should serve the virtuous friend.

original: dge sbyong la ni bsnyen bkur dang // zhes bya ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong la ni bsnyen bkur dang // zhes bya ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen bstan par bya'o //
translated: The virtuous friend is to be taught.

original: yang na 'phags pa'i gang zag la brten pas 'brel cing bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa'i gang zag la brten pas 'brel cing bslab par bya ste /
translated: Or, by relying on the noble person, one should be connected and trained.

original: gus pas yongs su bslab pa dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa sbyin pa'i ched du dge ba bstsags pa dang / yon tan la gus par bya ba'o /
analyzed: gus pas yongs su bslab pa dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa sbyin pa'i ched du dge ba bstsags pa dang / yon tan la gus par bya ba'o /
translated: It is the respectful complete training, the accumulation of virtue for the sake of giving alms, etc., and the respect for good qualities.

original: tshig rkang snga mas ye shes kyi tshogs bstan nas /
analyzed: tshig rkang snga mas ye shes kyi tshogs bstan nas /
translated: The first line teaches the accumulation of wisdom.

original: 'dis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs bstan to //
translated: This teaches the accumulation of merit.

original: de'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach its result, it is said:

original: dben pa dang ni stan gcig @55b dang ; / zhes bya ba gcig pu'i gnas skabs kyis dgon pa la sogs pa la de dang 'brel bar bslab pa ste /
analyzed: dben pa dang ni stan gcig @55b dang ; / zhes bya ba gcig pu'i gnas skabs kyis dgon pa la sogs pa la de dang 'brel bar bslab pa ste /
translated: The line in solitude, on a single seat refers to the training in the wilderness, etc. in the context of living alone.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows:

original: g-yeng ba med pas phra rgyas dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yeng ba med pas phra rgyas dgag pa yin no //
translated: By being undistracted, the negative tendencies are stopped.

original: 'dis ni lus dang sems dben par bstan to //üîΩsems ni nye bar zhi bar bya //
analyzed: 'dis ni lus dang sems dben par bstan to // sems ni nye bar zhi bar bya //
translated: This shows the solitude of body and mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa 'khrugs pa spangs pas sems mngon par 'byung ba ni nye bar zhi ba ste de la g-yeng ba dang rgod par byed pa thams cad dang bral bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa 'khrugs pa spangs pas sems mngon par 'byung ba ni nye bar zhi ba ste de la g-yeng ba dang rgod par byed pa thams cad dang bral bas so //
translated: The line the mind is pacified refers to the mind that has gone forth, which is free from all agitation and excitement, because it has abandoned the disturbance of the afflictions of the three realms.

original: de dang der 'brel pa'i gzhan gyi don byed par gyur na gdul bya yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang der 'brel pa'i gzhan gyi don byed par gyur na gdul bya yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is connected with this and that, it benefits others and those to be trained attain nirvana.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang // tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang // chos la chos kyi rjes su zhugs pas rim gyis 'dir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang // tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang // chos la chos kyi rjes su zhugs pas rim gyis 'dir bstan pa yin no //
translated: proper mental attention, and following the Dharma in regard to the Dharma, are taught here in sequence.

original: yang na dang po'i phyed kyis gzhan gyi sgra bstan to //
analyzed: yang na dang po'i phyed kyis gzhan gyi sgra bstan to //
translated: Or else, the first half teaches the words of another.

original: tshig rkang gsum pas ni tshul bzhin yod la byed pa'o /
analyzed: tshig rkang gsum pas ni tshul bzhin yod la byed pa'o /
translated: The third line teaches proper mental attention.

original: lhag mas ni de'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: lhag mas ni de'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: The remainder teaches its result.

original: gang gi phyir dben pa'i gnas nyid ni mngon pa 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dben pa'i gnas nyid ni mngon pa 'dod pa ste //
translated: Because the state of solitude is desired,

original: de nyid la gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid la gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to grasp that,

original: stan gcig pa dang gcig spyod dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: stan gcig pa dang gcig spyod dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúalone, without a companion,‚Äù and so on.

original: gcig pu grogs med pa'i gnas skabs de gdug pa'i gnas na spyod lam rnam pa gnyis 'dis bstan te /
analyzed: gcig pu grogs med pa'i gnas skabs de gdug pa'i gnas na spyod lam rnam pa gnyis 'dis bstan te /
translated: In the state of being alone, without a companion, this teaches two kinds of conduct in a solitary place.

original: gnyis pa'i cig shos ni 'og nas ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i cig shos ni 'og nas ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other two are taught later.

original: de la dga' bar bya ba ni de la rjes su bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de la dga' bar bya ba ni de la rjes su bsam pa'o //
translated: There, delighting in that is subsequent reflection.

original: mal bstan gcig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid gcig pu gnas pa'i mal bstan la dga' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mal bstan gcig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid gcig pu gnas pa'i mal bstan la dga' bar bya ba'o //
translated: The single bed is the bed of one who delights in living alone.

original: gang du 'dug nas ngal ba zhi bar byed pa ni mal stan no //
analyzed: gang du 'dug nas ngal ba zhi bar byed pa ni mal stan no //
translated: The bed is where one rests and relieves fatigue.

original: gcig pu spyod pa ni gcig pu gnas na bsod snyoms la sogs par rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: gcig pu spyod pa ni gcig pu gnas na bsod snyoms la sogs par rgyu ba ste /
translated: The single is the single bed of one who delights in living alone.

original: spyod pa rnam pa bzhi la gos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa rnam pa bzhi la gos pa med pa'o //
translated: The conduct is the four types of conduct, which are unattached.

original: de dag la spyod ba med cing brtson 'grus kyi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsnyom las med cing zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag la spyod ba med cing brtson 'grus kyi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir / snyom las med cing zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to teach the cause of effort, he says, without laziness.

original: le lo mi skyed cing brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pas so //
analyzed: le lo mi skyed cing brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pas so //
translated: One should delight in the single bed, etc., without generating laziness, through the perfection of effort.üîΩ The etc. includes the single seat, etc.

original: dga' bar bya zhes bya ba ni stan gcig la sogs pas mngon par dga' bar bya ba ste //
analyzed: dga' bar bya zhes bya ba ni stan gcig la sogs pas mngon par dga' bar bya ba ste //
translated: The single seat is the seat of one who delights in living alone.

original: de'i rjes su 'jug cing bsam par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jug cing bsam par bya ba'o //
translated: The seat is where one sits and eats alms-food, etc.

original: dang ni bsdu ba'i don te bdag nyid gcig pu yang dga' bar bya ba'o /
analyzed: dang ni bsdu ba'i don te bdag nyid gcig pu yang dga' bar bya ba'o /
translated: The single is the single seat of one who delights in living alone.üîΩThe conduct is the four types of conduct, which are unattached.üîΩ In order to teach the cause of effort, he says, without laziness.üîΩ One should delight in the single bed, etc., without generating laziness, through the perfection of effort.üîΩ The etc. includes the single seat, etc.

original: @56a * // 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir grogs med pa'i sems su bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩji skad du bshad pa bdag nyid chen po rnams ni grong gi nang du yang bdag nyid gcig pur 'gyur ram zhes de ltar rtog pa la /üîΩnags tshal gnas pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @56a * // 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir grogs med pa'i sems su bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // ji skad du bshad pa bdag nyid chen po rnams ni grong gi nang du yang bdag nyid gcig pur 'gyur ram zhes de ltar rtog pa la / nags tshal gnas pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to abandon the afflictions such as passion, one should be a solitary person.üîΩThe meaning is that one should be alone even in the midst of a village.üîΩBut if one cannot find a holy companion, one should live alone in the forest, as stated in the verse and in the forest.

original: grogs dam pa med par gyur na ni nags su bdag nyid gcig pu gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: grogs dam pa med par gyur na ni nags su bdag nyid gcig pu gnas par bya ste /
translated: The meaning is that one should live alone in the forest.

original: skye bo dam pa ma yin pa dang bsten pa ni ngan par spyod pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir dang / nags na gnas pa'i dben pa la sogs pa'i khyad par thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bo dam pa ma yin pa dang bsten pa ni ngan par spyod pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir dang / nags na gnas pa'i dben pa la sogs pa'i khyad par thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that the root of all bad conduct is reliance on an unholy person, and one obtains the distinction of solitude, etc., by living in the forest.

original: bdag nyid las rgyal ba ni 'bras bu chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag nyid las rgyal ba ni 'bras bu chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: The verse The wise man should conquer anger is stated to show that the conquest of anger is a great fruit.

original: gang zhig stong phrag stong dag gi / zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gang zhig stong phrag stong dag gi / zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo //
translated: The three verses beginning with ‚ÄúHe who has a thousand thousand‚Äù

original: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba 'thab mos 'tsho ba yod pa de brgya dang sprad kyang g-yul las rgyal byed de /
analyzed: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba 'thab mos 'tsho ba yod pa de brgya dang sprad kyang g-yul las rgyal byed de /
translated: There was a king named Prasenajit who had a warrior named Jayananda. Even when he was matched against a hundred, he was victorious in battle.

original: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: When the Blessed One heard about this, he said:

original: 'thab mos 'tsho ba thos te 'di bsam pa las ji ltar bdag nyid gdul bar mi bya zhing 'di las rgyal ba la mi sbyor zhes bsams te rgyal po la zhus nas rtag tu sngom pa spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis
analyzed: 'thab mos 'tsho ba thos te 'di bsam pa las ji ltar bdag nyid gdul bar mi bya zhing 'di las rgyal ba la mi sbyor zhes bsams te rgyal po la zhus nas rtag tu sngom pa spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis
translated: ‚ÄúThe warrior heard this and thought, ‚ÄòHow can I not tame myself and not apply myself to victory over this?‚Äô He asked the king for permission and always practiced restraint.

original: kyi don rtogs te dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: kyi don rtogs te dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
translated: The meaning of the two verses beginning with ‚ÄúAlways practicing restraint‚Äù was understood, and he attained the fruit of arhatship.

original: gang la la zhig grangs stong phrag stong dag gi mi dang 'thab pa ste stong phrag stong dang 'thab pa'i 'thab mo'i sar ro //
analyzed: gang la la zhig grangs stong phrag stong dag gi mi dang 'thab pa ste stong phrag stong dang 'thab pa'i 'thab mo'i sar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHe who has a thousand thousand‚Äù means he who fights with a thousand thousand people, he who fights in a battle with a thousand thousand.

original: rgyal ba ni gzhan pham bar byas pa ste 'bum phrag bcu las rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgang zhig bdag las rgyal byed pa //
analyzed: rgyal ba ni gzhan pham bar byas pa ste 'bum phrag bcu las rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i don to // gang zhig bdag las rgyal byed pa //
translated: The Victor is the one who conquers others, i.e., the one who is victorious in the battle with the ten million.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang bdag gi sems gcig pu dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang bdag gi sems gcig pu dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: The one who conquers himself is the one who tames his own mind alone.

original: de ni de nyid de bdag nyid dul ba nyid do /
analyzed: de ni de nyid de bdag nyid dul ba nyid do /
translated: That is the truth, i.e., the self-taming itself.

original: g-yul de gnyis las bdag nyid dul ba ni rgyal ba'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: g-yul de gnyis las bdag nyid dul ba ni rgyal ba'i mchog yin no //
translated: Of those two battles, the self-taming is the supreme victory.

original: gzhan gyi stobs mchog tu 'joms par byed pa'i g-yul te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi stobs mchog tu 'joms par byed pa'i g-yul te /
translated: The other is the battle that conquers the supreme power,

original: gzhan gyi stobs las rgyal bar byed cing sel ba ni g-yul las rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi stobs las rgyal bar byed cing sel ba ni g-yul las rgyal ba'o //
translated: the victory in the battle is the victory over the power of the other, i.e., the removal of the power of the other.

original: de gnyis las kyang khyad par du g-yul las rgyal ba ni spang bar dka' ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dgra sel bar byed @56b pa'i phyir bdag nyid las rgyal ba nyid mchog yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis las kyang khyad par du g-yul las rgyal ba ni spang bar dka' ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dgra sel bar byed @56b pa'i phyir bdag nyid las rgyal ba nyid mchog yin te /
translated: And of those two, the victory in the battle is supreme, because it conquers the enemy of the afflictions that are difficult to abandon.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //üîΩbdag nyid ces bya ba smos te //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir // bdag nyid ces bya ba smos te //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:üîΩThe one who conquers himself

original: bdag gi sems las so //
analyzed: bdag gi sems las so //
translated: is the one who conquers his own mind.

original: gang gi phyir 'bum phrag bcu dang 'thab pa'i skyes bu las kyang bdag nyid dul ba g-yul las rgyal pa'i mchog yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bum phrag bcu dang 'thab pa'i skyes bu las kyang bdag nyid dul ba g-yul las rgyal pa'i mchog yin te /
translated: Because self-discipline is the best victory in battle, even better than the victory of ten thousand brave warriors.

original: de bas na bdag nyid rgyal ba dang dul par byas pa ni mchog tu bsngags pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid rgyal ba dang dul par byas pa ni mchog tu bsngags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the victory and self-discipline of the self is praised as the best.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni skye dgu gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni skye dgu gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Others are not like this.

original: sems can rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i phyir dang / skye dgu ni nga rgyal yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i phyir dang / skye dgu ni nga rgyal yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Beings are under the control of the afflictions and the world has pride.

original: phal pa zhes bya ba la phal pa'i sgra ni ngan pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phal pa zhes bya ba la phal pa'i sgra ni ngan pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word ordinary is a synonym for bad.

original: nyon mongs pas rgyud gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas rgyud gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that the mindstream is under the control of others, i.e., the afflictions.

original: gang yang seng ge zil gyis gnon pa ni mchog yin gyi gang ba ni ma yin pa de bzhin du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang seng ge zil gyis gnon pa ni mchog yin gyi gang ba ni ma yin pa de bzhin du ston pa yin no //
translated: Just as a lion is the best at overpowering, not an elephant, so is the teacher.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that, he says:

original: mi yis bdag gdul gcig pu yis //
analyzed: mi yis bdag gdul gcig pu yis //
translated: Only by humans is the self to be disciplined.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: gdul ba ni 'di ltar sems can gyi rang gi sems so //
analyzed: gdul ba ni 'di ltar sems can gyi rang gi sems so //
translated: Here, the self is the mind of sentient beings.

original: lha yis ma yin te /
analyzed: lha yis ma yin te /
translated: It is not by the gods,

original: gzhan gyis pham par mi nus zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis pham par mi nus zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: because it cannot be defeated by others.

original: bdag gdul ba ni so sor thar pa'i sngom pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: bdag gdul ba ni so sor thar pa'i sngom pa sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: The self is the training, because it is preceded by the vow of individual liberation.

original: rtag tu sngom pa spyod pa zhes bya ba rtag tu yang dag par sdom pas nye bar mtshon cing spyod la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sngom pa spyod pa zhes bya ba rtag tu yang dag par sdom pas nye bar mtshon cing spyod la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: He always practices the vow, always characterized by perfect restraint, and he practices and engages in it.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la rtag tu 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la rtag tu 'jug pa yin te /
translated: He is always engaged in the vow of morality in two ways.

original: snga mas ni dbang po sdom par bstan la /
analyzed: snga mas ni dbang po sdom par bstan la /
translated: The former shows restraint of the senses,

original: 'dis ni lus dang ngag gi sdom pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni lus dang ngag gi sdom pa bstan te /
translated: and this shows restraint of body and speech.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis tshogs kyi sbyor ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis tshogs kyi sbyor ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he shows the application of the equipment in three ways.

original: lha yis ma yin zhes bya ba ni de las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: lha yis ma yin zhes bya ba ni de las 'das pa ste /
translated: It is not by the gods, because it is beyond that.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i'o //
translated: It is of the gods who enjoy the desire realm.

original: dri zas min zhes bya ba ni legs dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rol mo byed pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dri zas min zhes bya ba ni legs dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rol mo byed pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The Gandharvas are those who play musical instruments, such as the one called Supriya.

original: bdud ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: bdud ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The Maruts are the lords of the desire realm.

original: tshangs par bcas pa zhes bya ba ni stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bdag po ste //
analyzed: tshangs par bcas pa zhes bya ba ni stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bdag po ste //
translated: Brahma is the lord of the world system consisting of a triple-thousand great thousand worlds.

original: de dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: de dang bcas pas so //
translated: He is the one who is together with them.

original: pham mi nus zhes bya ba ni gang zad cing sel bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: pham mi nus zhes bya ba ni gang zad cing sel bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: They cannot be defeated means that they cannot be overcome or eliminated.

original: dbang po dang tshul khrims ji lta bu dang ldan pa la pham par mi nus she na //
analyzed: dbang po dang tshul khrims ji lta bu dang ldan pa la pham par mi nus she na //
translated: What kind of faculties and morality do they have that they cannot be defeated?

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ste //
translated: They are bhik·π£us means

original: nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshes @57a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir ro // shes @57a * //
translated: that they have destroyed the afflictions.

original: rab kyi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa bcom par ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab kyi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa bcom par ston pa'i phyir /
translated: The power of wisdom is taught in order to show that the afflictions are destroyed by the power of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis gnas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis gnas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThey abide in wisdom.‚Äù

original: shes rab ni zag pa med pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: shes rab ni zag pa med pa'i shes pas so //
translated: Wisdom is the uncontaminated knowledge.

original: gnas pa ni 'jug pa ste des tshul dam pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni 'jug pa ste des tshul dam pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding is engagement, and they abide in the highest morality by that.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi dbang gis phra rgyas spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi dbang gis phra rgyas spangs pa yin te /
translated: The power of uncontaminated wisdom abandons the negative tendencies.

original: gang yang mi zad par byed nus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang mi zad par byed nus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not able to make them completely disappear.

original: de'i phyir dge slong dag gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs par gyur pa'o zhes mdo las gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong dag gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs par gyur pa'o zhes mdo las gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the sutra says, ‚ÄúMonks, when they are abandoned by the wisdom of the noble ones.‚Äù

original: nga 'jig pa'i bskal pas bsreg par bya ba gang yin pa de gzhan gang gis kyang mi nus pa bzhin du 'di ltar 'bum phrag bcu las gang rgyal ba de nyid kyis ni 'di pham par mi nus te //
analyzed: nga 'jig pa'i bskal pas bsreg par bya ba gang yin pa de gzhan gang gis kyang mi nus pa bzhin du 'di ltar 'bum phrag bcu las gang rgyal ba de nyid kyis ni 'di pham par mi nus te //

original: bdag nyid shes dang ji ltar mkhas pa zhes mi brjod de /

original: de ni shes rab dang ldan pa'o //

original: byis pa gang zhig mkhas sems pa //

original: zhes bya ba ni gang yang chos rnams mngon par mi shes kyang mkhas par sems pa 'di la yod pa ste bdag ni mkhas pa'o zhes sems shing mkhas pa bstan bcos du ma rtogs shing bsten pa dag dang mnyam par sems pa'o //
